title: Remove legal/novelty notices from customer ordering flow UI

requirements.summary: Remove the “Important Legal Notice” section and other legal/novelty disclaimer messaging from the marketing homepage while keeping layout intact.
acceptanceCriteria: Home page no longer renders the section titled “Important Legal Notice”.

Home page no longer includes the novelty/entertainment-only disclaimer sentences (e.g., “novelty… for entertainment… only”, “not intended to be used as real identification”, “Using novelty IDs… is illegal”).
Page layout remains visually consistent and free of empty gaps where the removed section previously appeared.

file_operations.description: Remove the entire “Important Legal Notice” section and delete/rewrite homepage copy blocks and cards that contain novelty/legal disclaimer language (e.g., hero subtitle and “Novelty Only”/About copy), ensuring the remaining sections reflow cleanly with no empty spacing.

requirements.summary: Remove legal/novelty notice UI and lawful-use attestation gating from the order page so users can submit orders without acknowledging disclaimers.
acceptanceCriteria: Order page no longer shows the warning alert that starts with “Novelty Use Only:”.
Any attestation checkbox and related copy (lawful-use agreement) is removed from the order form UI.
Client-side validation no longer blocks submission due to attestation (i.e., no “You must agree to the lawful use attestation to proceed” error).
Submitting an order still requires the existing required fields (contact/shipping fields, ID info fields, photo, signature) and successfully calls the existing submit order mutation.

file_operations.description: Remove the warning alert block containing “Novelty Use Only:” messaging; remove the lawful-use attestation checkbox UI and all related state/validation/error handling (attestationChecked, fieldErrors.attestation, and submission blocking), while preserving required-field validation for contact/shipping, ID info, photo, and signature and keeping the existing submit order mutation call unchanged.

requirements.summary: Remove legal/novelty disclaimer wording from other customer-facing ordering-flow pages (prices and order confirmation) while preserving core content.
acceptanceCriteria: Prices and confirmation pages do not include legal/novelty disclaimer notice text (e.g., “novelty… for entertainment… only”, “not real government IDs”, “illegal”, “lawful use only”).
All pages still render without runtime errors and keep their core content (pricing, payment contact info, order ID, next steps).

file_operations.description: Remove or rewrite customer-facing text that includes novelty/legal disclaimer language (e.g., FAQ entry about “Are these real IDs?” and any “novelty” disclaimers), while keeping pricing amounts, payment contact information, and accepted payment methods unchanged.

Remove or rewrite any legal/novelty disclaimer wording in confirmation content (including “novelty” mentions and any disclaimer-like phrasing) while preserving the order ID display, payment contact instructions, and next-steps timeline; ensure the page still renders without runtime errors.
